indicators.name_fr: Point de soin moderne efficace et diagnostic en laboratoire
indicators.name_en: Effective modern point of care and laboratory based diagnostics

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucune preuve de l'utilisation rapide et précise des diagnostics des points de soins et de laboratoire. Aucune stratégie de test de diagnostic spécifique à un niveau n'est documentée.
score_descriptions_fr.2: La capacité de diagnostic de laboratoire est minimale dans le pays, mais aucune stratégie de test de diagnostic spécifique à un niveau n'est documentée. Les diagnostics aux points de service sont utilisés pour les maladies prioritaires du pays
score_descriptions_fr.3: Les stratégies de tests diagnostiques spécifiques de niveau sont documentées, mais pas entièrement mises en œuvre. Le pays maîtrise les techniques classiques de diagnostic, y compris la bactériologie, la sérologie et la PCR dans certains laboratoires, mais ses processus de référence et de confirmation sont limités. Le pays utilise les diagnostics aux points de service pour les maladies prioritaires et au moins une autre maladie prioritaire.
score_descriptions_fr.4: Le pays dispose de stratégies de tests diagnostiques spécifiques de niveau documentées et pleinement mises en œuvre, d'un système national de référence d'échantillons et de diagnostics de confirmation aboutissant à la mise en œuvre de techniques moléculaires ou sérologiques modernes dans des laboratoires nationaux et / ou régionaux. Le pays utilise les diagnostics des points de service en fonction des stratégies de diagnostic spécifiques au diagnostic de maladies prioritaires du pays
score_descriptions_fr.5: Le pays dispose d'une capacité durable pour l'exécution de techniques moléculaires et sérologiques modernes dans le cadre d'un système national de référence d'échantillons et de diagnostics de confirmation. Le pays utilise des diagnostics rapides et précis au point de service, tels que définis par les stratégies de tests de diagnostic spécifiques de niveau. Le pays engage également formellement d'autres laboratoires de référence pour tester la capacité non disponible dans le pays lorsque cela est nécessaire pour compléter les stratégies nationales de diagnostic pour sept ou plus de dix tests de laboratoire requis pour les maladies prioritaires. Le pays peut maintenir cette capacité seul (pas plus de 20% de dépendance vis-à-vis du financement des donateurs).

score_descriptions_en.1: No evidence of use of rapid and accurate point of care and laboratory based diagnostics. No tier specific diagnostic testing strategies are documented.
score_descriptions_en.2: Minimal, laboratory diagnostic capability exists within the country, but no tier specific diagnostic testing strategies are documented. point of care diagnostics being used for country priority diseases
score_descriptions_en.3: Tier specific diagnostic testing strategies are documented, but not fully implemented. Country is proficient in classical diagnostic techniques including bacteriology, serology and PCR in select labs but has limited referral and confirmatory processes. Country is using point of care diagnostics for country priority diseases, and at least one other priority disease.
score_descriptions_en.4: Country has tier specific diagnostic testing strategies documented and fully implemented, a national system of sample referral and confirmatory diagnostics culminating in performance of modern molecular or serological techniques at national and/or regional laboratories. Country is using point of care diagnostics according to tier specific diagnostic testing strategies for diagnosis of country priority diseases
score_descriptions_en.5: Country has sustainable capability for performing modern molecular and serological techniques as part of a national system of sample referral and confirmatory diagnostics. Country is using rapid and accurate point of care diagnostics as defined by tier specific diagnostic testing strategies. Country is also engaging formally other reference laboratories for testing capacity not available in country where needed to supplement the national diagnostic testing strategies for seven or more of ten lab tests required for priority diseases Country is able to sustain this capability on its own (no more than 20% dependence on donor funding).

indicators.name: Laboratory Quality System

score_descriptions.1: There are no national laboratory quality standards.
score_descriptions.2: National quality standards have been developed but there is no system for verifying their implementation
score_descriptions.3: A system of licensing of health laboratories that includes conformity to a national quality standard exists but it is voluntary or is not a requirement for all laboratories.
score_descriptions.4: Mandatory licensing of all health laboratories is in place and conformity to a national quality standard is required.
score_descriptions.5: Mandatory licensing of all health laboratories is in place and conformity to an international quality standard is required.

indicators.name_fr: Système de contrôle-qualité de laboratoire
indicators.name_en: Laboratory Quality System

score_descriptions_fr.1: Il n'y a pas de normes nationales de qualité de laboratoire.
score_descriptions_fr.2: Des normes de qualité nationales ont été élaborées mais il n'existe aucun système de vérification de leur mise en œuvre
score_descriptions_fr.3: Un système de licence des laboratoires de santé qui inclut la conformité à une norme de qualité nationale existe mais il est volontaire ou n'est pas une exigence pour tous les laboratoires.
score_descriptions_fr.4: L'homologation obligatoire de tous les laboratoires de santé est en place et la conformité à une norme de qualité nationale est requise.
score_descriptions_fr.5: L'homologation obligatoire de tous les laboratoires de santé est en place et la conformité à une norme de qualité internationale est requise.

score_descriptions_en.1: There are no national laboratory quality standards.
score_descriptions_en.2: National quality standards have been developed but there is no system for verifying their implementation
score_descriptions_en.3: A system of licensing of health laboratories that includes conformity to a national quality standard exists but it is voluntary or is not a requirement for all laboratories.
score_descriptions_en.4: Mandatory licensing of all health laboratories is in place and conformity to a national quality standard is required.
score_descriptions_en.5: Mandatory licensing of all health laboratories is in place and conformity to an international quality standard is required.

capacities.target_description_fr: Biosurveillance en temps réel avec un système de laboratoire national et un diagnostic moderne efficace aux points de service et en laboratoire.
capacities.target_description_en: Real-time biosurveillance with a national laboratory system and effective modern point-of-care and laboratory-based diagnostics.
capacities.as_measured_by_en: A nationwide laboratory system able to reliably conduct at least five of the 10 core tests on appropriately identified and collected outbreak specimens transported safely and securely to accredited laboratories from at least 80 percent of intermediate level/districts in the country
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Utilisation efficace d'un système de laboratoire national capable de détecter et de caractériser, de manière sûre et précise, les agents pathogènes responsables de maladies épidémiques, y compris les menaces connues et nouvelles, dans toutes les régions du pays. Le déploiement, l'utilisation et le maintien renforcés de tests ou de dispositifs de diagnostic modernes, sûrs, sécurisés, abordables et appropriés sont mis en place.
capacities.desired_impact_en: Effective use of a nationwide laboratory system capable of safely and accurately detecting and characterizing pathogens causing epidemic disease, including both known and novel threats, from all parts of the country. Expanded deployment, utilization and sustainment of modern, safe, secure, affordable and appropriate diagnostic tests or devices established.
capacities.notes_fr: Les indicateurs se rapportent à la capacité du laboratoire national pour le pays. Le système de laboratoire national devrait inclure la capacité de mener au moins cinq des dix tests de base, la capacité de transporter des échantillons rapidement et en toute sécurité de 80% ou plus des installations nationales de laboratoire pour les diagnostics avancés, et la capacité à effectuer des tests de diagnostic de niveau supérieur dans les laboratoires nationaux ou des accords avec des réseaux régionaux pour s'assurer que les tests soient disponibles. Les tests de base peuvent inclure des tests de priorité locaux déterminés par des agents pathogènes indicateurs sélectionnés par le pays sur la base de préoccupations nationales majeures en matière de santé publique.
capacities.notes_en: The indicators refer to national laboratory capacity for the country.,The national laboratory system should include the ability to conduct at least five of the ten core tests, the ability to transport specimens safely and quickly from 80% or more of intermediate levels/districts to national laboratory facilities for advanced diagnostics, and the ability to conduct higher level diagnostic testing at national laboratories or agreements with regional networks to ensure testing is available.,Core tests can include local priority tests determined by country-selected indicator pathogens on the basis of major national public health concern.

capacities.name: Real Time Surveillance
capacities.target_description: Strengthened foundational indicator- and event-based surveillance systems that are able to detect events of significance for public health, animal health and health security; improved communication and collaboration across sectors and between sub-national (local and intermediate), national and international levels of authority regarding surveillance of events of public health significance; improved country and intermediate level/regional capacity to analyse and link data from and between strengthened, real-time surveillance systems, including interoperable, interconnected electronic reporting systems. This can include epidemiologic, clinical, laboratory, environmental testing, product safety and quality, and bioinformatics data; and advancement in fulfilling the core capacity requirements for surveillance in accordance with the IHR and the OIE standards.
capacities.as_measured_by: Surveillance for at least three core syndromes indicative of potential public health emergencies conducted according to international standards.
capacities.desired_impact: A functioning public health surveillance system capable of identifying potential events of concern for public health and health security, and country and intermediate level/regional capacity to analyse and link data from and between strengthened real-time surveillance systems, including interoperable, interconnected electronic reporting systems. Countries will support the use of interoperable, interconnected systems capable of linking and integrating multi-sectoral surveillance data and using resulting information to enhance the capacity to quickly detect and respond to developing biological threats. Foundational capacity is necessary for both indicator based (including syndromic) surveillance and event-based surveillance, in order to support prevention and control activities and intervention targeting for both established infectious diseases and new and emerging public health threats. Strong surveillance will support the timely recognition of the emergence of relatively rare or previously undescribed pathogens in specific countries.
capacities.notes: The indicator refers to surveillance capacity for the country.,The real-time surveillance system should include the ability to conduct surveillance for at least three core syndromes indicative of a public health emergency, the ability to provide reports and data to high level public health decision makers in country, and feedback to lower levels implementing control programs, and the linkages to laboratory and other information systems to provide a complete surveillance picture,Event-based surveillance is the organized and rapid capture of information about events that are a potential risk to public health. This information can be rumours and other ad-hoc reports transmitted through formal channels (i.e. established routine reporting systems) and informal channels (i.e. media, health workers and nongovernmental organizations reports) and can supplement traditional syndromic surveillance.

indicators.name: Indicator and event based surveillance systems

score_descriptions.1: No indicator or event-based surveillance systems exist.
score_descriptions.2: Indicator and event-based surveillance system(s) planned to begin within a year
score_descriptions.3: Indicator OR event-based surveillance system(s) in place to detect public health threats
score_descriptions.4: Indicator and event-based surveillance system(s) in place to detect public health threats
score_descriptions.5: In addition to surveillance systems in country, using expertise to support other countries in developing surveillance systems and provide well-standardized data to WHO and OIE for the past five years without significant external support

inputs.name: Server system for electronic disease surveillance data server

line_items.name: Server system
line_items.description: Cost of 1 computer server system and associated technical infrastructure
line_items.function_tag: Analysis including data quality and dissemination
line_items.references: Commercial costs in US/Europe. Assumes 1 computer per surveillance unit. Default: Average selling price desktop personal computers worldwide (https://www.statista.com/statistics/203759/average-selling-price-of-desktop-pcs-worldwide/)
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Per computer: use government procurement schedule or local market rates to determine costs per desktop or laptop personal computer.
line_items.description_fr: Coût d'un système de serveur informatique et infrastructure technique associée
line_items.description_en: Cost of 1 computer server system and associated technical infrastructure
line_items.function_tag_fr: Analyse incluant la qualité et la diffusion des données
line_items.function_tag_en: Analysis including data quality and dissemination
line_items.references_fr: Coûts commerciaux aux États-Unis / Europe. Présumer 1 ordinateur par unité de surveillance. Valeur par défaut: Ordinateurs personnels de bureau à prix de vente moyen dans le monde entier (<https://www.statista.com/statistics/203759/average-selling-price-of-desktop-pcs-worldwide/>)
line_items.references_en: Commercial costs in US/Europe. Assumes 1 computer per surveillance unit. Default: Average selling price desktop personal computers worldwide (https://www.statista.com/statistics/203759/average-selling-price-of-desktop-pcs-worldwide/)
line_items.where_find_base_cost_fr: Par ordinateur: utiliser le calendrier des achats du gouvernement ou les taux du marché local pour déterminer les coûts par ordinateur de bureau ou ordinateur portable.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_en: Per computer: use government procurement schedule or local market rates to determine costs per desktop or laptop personal computer.

indicators.name_fr: Systèmes de surveillance fondés sur des indicateurs et des événements
indicators.name_en: Indicator and event based surveillance systems

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun indicateur ou système de surveillance événementielle n'existe.
score_descriptions_fr.2: Système (s) de surveillance événementielle et basée sur les indicateurs dont le démarrage est prévu dans l'année
score_descriptions_fr.3: Système (s) de surveillance événementielle OU basée sur les indicateurs est en place pour détecter les menaces pour la santé publique
score_descriptions_fr.4: Système (s) de surveillance événementielle et basée sur les indicateurs est en place pour détecter les menaces pour la santé publique
score_descriptions_fr.5: En plus des systèmes de surveillance dans le pays, l'expertise est utilisée pour aider d'autres pays à développer des systèmes de surveillance et fournir des données standardisées à l'OMS et à l'OIE au cours des cinq dernières années sans un soutien externe significatif.

score_descriptions_en.1: No indicator or event-based surveillance systems exist.
score_descriptions_en.2: Indicator and event-based surveillance system(s) planned to begin within a year
score_descriptions_en.3: Indicator OR event-based surveillance system(s) in place to detect public health threats
score_descriptions_en.4: Indicator and event-based surveillance system(s) in place to detect public health threats
score_descriptions_en.5: In addition to surveillance systems in country, using expertise to support other countries in developing surveillance systems and provide well-standardized data to WHO and OIE for the past five years without significant external support

indicators.name: Interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system

score_descriptions.1: No interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system exists
score_descriptions.2: Country is developing an interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system, for either public health or veterinary surveillance systems
score_descriptions.3: Country has in place an inter-operable, interconnected, electronic reporting system, for either public health or veterinary surveillance systems. The system is not yet able to share data in real-time.
score_descriptions.4: Country has in place and interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system, for public health and/or veterinary surveillance systems. The system is not yet fully sustained by the host government.
score_descriptions.5: Country has in place an inter-operable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system, including both the public health and veterinary surveillance systems which is sustained by the government and capable of sharing data with relevant stake-holders according to country policies and international obligations.

actions.name: Establish and maintain intermediate-level surveillance units

inputs.name: Cellular phones for unit staff

line_items.name: Cellular and data annual plan fee
line_items.description: Mobile cellular and broadband services to ensure that surveillance unit staff are available by voice, SMS, and email on a 24/7/365 basis
line_items.references: Assume full participation in intermediate areas; Default: average regional costs per smartphone user from ITU  (http://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Documents/publications/misr2016/MISR2016-w4.pdf).
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Smartphone/mobile phone usage costs: determine local data/SMS/voice plan costs based on market data from local mobile phone service providers and adjust the base multipler (number of phones) to reflect number of surveillance officers.
line_items.name_fr: Forfait annuel téléphones portables et données mobiles
line_items.name_en: Cellular and data annual plan fee
line_items.description_fr: Services mobiles à haut débit pour garantir que le personnel de l'unité de surveillance soit disponible par messagerie vocale, par SMS et par e-mail 24 heures sur 24, 365 jours par an
line_items.description_en: Mobile cellular and broadband services to ensure that surveillance unit staff are available by voice, SMS, and email on a 24/7/365 basis
line_items.function_tag_fr: Opérations / mise en œuvre
line_items.references_fr: Présumer une pleine participation dans les zones intermédiaires ; Valeur par défaut: coûts régionaux moyens par utilisateur de smartphone de l'UIT (<http://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Documents/publications/misr2016/MISR2016-w4.pdf>).
line_items.references_en: Assume full participation in intermediate areas; Default: average regional costs per smartphone user from ITU  (http://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Statistics/Documents/publications/misr2016/MISR2016-w4.pdf).
line_items.where_find_base_cost_fr: Coûts d'utilisation des smartphones / téléphones mobiles : déterminer les coûts des forfait pour données locales / SMS / vocal en fonction des données de marché des fournisseurs de services de téléphonie mobile locaux et ajuster le multiplicateur de base (nombre de téléphones) pour refléter le nombre d'agents de surveillance.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_en: Smartphone/mobile phone usage costs: determine local data/SMS/voice plan costs based on market data from local mobile phone service providers and adjust the base multipler (number of phones) to reflect number of surveillance officers.

line_items.name: Cellular phones
line_items.description: Mobile phones for surveillance unit staff
line_items.references: Default costs: average regional cost per smartphone at https://www.statista.com/statistics/283334/global-average-selling-price-smartphones/
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Smartphone/mobile phone costs: determine local per handset costs based on market data from local mobile phone providers and adjust the base multipler (number of phones) to reflect number of surveillance officers.
line_items.description_fr: Téléphones portables pour le personnel de l'unité de surveillance
line_items.description_en: Mobile phones for surveillance unit staff
line_items.function_tag_fr: Opérations / mise en œuvre
line_items.references_fr: Coûts par défaut: coût régional moyen par smartphone à <https://www.statista.com/statistics/283334/global-average-selling-price-smartphones/>
line_items.references_en: Default costs: average regional cost per smartphone at https://www.statista.com/statistics/283334/global-average-selling-price-smartphones/

inputs.name: Hold workshops to develop plan for cross-sector shared data platform

line_items.name: Workshop expenditures
line_items.description: Workshops for national stakeholders from human health, animal health, and laboratory sector to set standards and develop action plan for integrating electronic surveillance data into a shared platform (such as a dashboard) accessible across sectors. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.
line_items.function_tag: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.description_fr: Ateliers pour les parties prenantes nationales du secteur de la santé humaine, de la santé animale et des laboratoires afin d'établir des normes et d'élaborer un plan d'action pour intégrer les données de surveillance électronique dans une plateforme partagée (par ex. tableau de bord) accessible à tous les secteurs. Comprend la location d'installations, la papeterie, les rafraîchissements et autres frais accessoires.
line_items.description_en: Workshops for national stakeholders from human health, animal health, and laboratory sector to set standards and develop action plan for integrating electronic surveillance data into a shared platform (such as a dashboard) accessible across sectors. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.

actions.name_fr: Maintenir la plate-forme électronique de données de surveillance des maladies
actions.name_en: Maintain electronic disease surveillance data platform

indicators.name_fr: Système interopérable, interconnecté, de notification électronique en temps réel
indicators.name_en: Interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system

score_descriptions_fr.1: Il n'existe aucun système interopérable et interconnecté de rapports électroniques en temps réel.
score_descriptions_fr.2: Le pays est en train de mettre au point un système de notification électronique en temps réel interopérable et interconnecté, pour les systèmes de surveillance de la santé publique ou vétérinaire.
score_descriptions_fr.3: Le pays a mis en place un système de rapport électronique interopérable, interconnecté, pour les systèmes de surveillance de santé publique ou vétérinaire. Le système n'est pas encore en mesure de partager des données en temps réel.
score_descriptions_fr.4: Le pays a mis en place un système électronique interopérable, interconnecté, de notification en temps réel, pour les systèmes de surveillance sanitaire et / ou vétérinaire. Le système n'est pas encore entièrement soutenu par le gouvernement hôte.
score_descriptions_fr.5: Le pays a mis en place un système életronique interactif, interconnecté de notification en temps réel, comprenant à la fois les systèmes de surveillance sanitaire et vétérinaire soutenus par le gouvernement et capables de partager les données avec les parties prenantes conformément aux politiques nationales et aux obligations internationales. .

score_descriptions_en.1: No interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system exists
score_descriptions_en.2: Country is developing an interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system, for either public health or veterinary surveillance systems
score_descriptions_en.3: Country has in place an inter-operable, interconnected, electronic reporting system, for either public health or veterinary surveillance systems. The system is not yet able to share data in real-time.
score_descriptions_en.4: Country has in place and interoperable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system, for public health and/or veterinary surveillance systems. The system is not yet fully sustained by the host government.
score_descriptions_en.5: Country has in place an inter-operable, interconnected, electronic real-time reporting system, including both the public health and veterinary surveillance systems which is sustained by the government and capable of sharing data with relevant stake-holders according to country policies and international obligations.

indicators.name: Integration and analysis of surveillance data

score_descriptions.1: No reports related to data collection
score_descriptions.2: Sporadic reports related to data collection with delay
score_descriptions.3: Regular reporting of data with some delay; ad-hoc teams put in place to analyse data
score_descriptions.4: Annually or monthly reporting; attributed functions to experts for analysing, assessing and reporting data
score_descriptions.5: Systematic reporting; dedicated team in place for data analysis, risk assessment and reporting

indicators.name_fr: Intégration et analyse des données de surveillance
indicators.name_en: Integration and analysis of surveillance data

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun rapport lié à la collecte de données
score_descriptions_fr.2: Rapports sporadiques liés à la collecte de données, avec retard
score_descriptions_fr.3: Rapports réguliers des données avec un certain retard; équipes ad-hoc mises en place pour analyser les données
score_descriptions_fr.4: Rapports annuels ou mensuels, attribution de fonctions à des experts pour l'analyse, l'évaluation et la communication de données
score_descriptions_fr.5: Rapports systématiques; équipe dédiée en place pour l'analyse des données, l'évaluation des risques et le reporting

score_descriptions_en.1: No reports related to data collection
score_descriptions_en.2: Sporadic reports related to data collection with delay
score_descriptions_en.3: Regular reporting of data with some delay; ad-hoc teams put in place to analyse data
score_descriptions_en.4: Annually or monthly reporting; attributed functions to experts for analysing, assessing and reporting data
score_descriptions_en.5: Systematic reporting; dedicated team in place for data analysis, risk assessment and reporting

indicators.name: Syndromic surveillance systems

score_descriptions.1: No syndromic surveillance systems exist
score_descriptions.2: Syndromic surveillance system(s) planned to begin within the next year; policy/legislation is in place to allow for syndromic surveillance
score_descriptions.3: Syndromic surveillance system(s) in place to detect 1-2 core syndromes indicative of public health emergencies
score_descriptions.4: Syndromic surveillance system(s) in place to detect three or more core syndromes indicative of public health emergencies
score_descriptions.5: In addition to surveillance systems in country, using expertise to support other countries in developing surveillance systems

actions.name: Develop plan and guidance for syndromic surveillance at sentinel sites

inputs.name: Hold workshop for technical experts to develop plan

line_items.name: Workshop expenditures
line_items.description: Workshop for technical experts in health sector, surveillance units, information systems, and other relevant ministries to assess current legislative/regulatory framework and develop a national policy, plan, or strategy for syndromic surveillance at sentinel sites. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.
line_items.function_tag: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.description_fr: Atelier pour des experts techniques du secteur de la santé, des unités de surveillance, des systèmes d'information et autres ministères concernés pour évaluer le cadre législatif / réglementaire actuel et élaborer une politique, un plan ou une stratégie nationale de surveillance syndromique dans les sites sentinelles. indicators.name_fr: Systèmes de surveillance syndromique
indicators.name_en: Syndromic surveillance systems

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun système de surveillance syndromique n'existe
score_descriptions_fr.2: Le (s) système (s) de surveillance syndromique devrait commencer au cours de la prochaine année; une politique / législation est en place pour permettre la surveillance syndromique
score_descriptions_fr.3: Système (s) de surveillance syndromique en place pour détecter un ou deux syndromes de base indiquant des urgences de santé publique
score_descriptions_fr.4: Système (s) de surveillance syndromique en place pour détecter trois syndromes de base ou plus révélateurs d'urgences de santé publique
score_descriptions_fr.5: En plus des systèmes de surveillance dans le pays, utiliser l'expertise pour aider d'autres pays à développer des systèmes de surveillance

score_descriptions_en.1: No syndromic surveillance systems exist
score_descriptions_en.2: Syndromic surveillance system(s) planned to begin within the next year; policy/legislation is in place to allow for syndromic surveillance
score_descriptions_en.3: Syndromic surveillance system(s) in place to detect 1-2 core syndromes indicative of public health emergencies
score_descriptions_en.4: Syndromic surveillance system(s) in place to detect three or more core syndromes indicative of public health emergencies
score_descriptions_en.5: In addition to surveillance systems in country, using expertise to support other countries in developing surveillance systems

capacities.target_description_fr: Des systèmes de surveillance fondés sur les indicateurs et les événements sont capables de détecter des événements importants pour la santé publique, la santé animale et la sécurité sanitaire; amélioration de la communication et de la collaboration entre les secteurs et entre les niveaux d'autorité infranationaux (locaux et intermédiaires), nationaux et internationaux en ce qui concerne la surveillance des événements importants pour la santé publique; amélioration de la capacité des pays et des niveaux intermédiaires / régionaux d'analyser et de relier les données issues des systèmes de surveillance en temps réel renforcés et entre ceux-ci, y compris les systèmes interopérables de notifications électroniques interconnectés. Cela peut inclure des données épidémiologiques, cliniques, de laboratoire, environnementales, d'innocuité et de qualité des produits et des données bioinformatiques; et des progrès dans le respect des principales capacités requises pour la surveillance, conformément aux normes du RSI et de l'OIE.
capacities.target_description_en: Strengthened foundational indicator- and event-based surveillance systems that are able to detect events of significance for public health, animal health and health security; improved communication and collaboration across sectors and between sub-national (local and intermediate), national and international levels of authority regarding surveillance of events of public health significance; improved country and intermediate level/regional capacity to analyse and link data from and between strengthened, real-time surveillance systems, including interoperable, interconnected electronic reporting systems. This can include epidemiologic, clinical, laboratory, environmental testing, product safety and quality, and bioinformatics data; and advancement in fulfilling the core capacity requirements for surveillance in accordance with the IHR and the OIE standards.
capacities.as_measured_by_en: Surveillance for at least three core syndromes indicative of potential public health emergencies conducted according to international standards.
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Un système de surveillance de la santé publique capable d'identifier les événements potentiels préoccupants pour la santé publique et la sécurité sanitaire, et la capacité des pays et des niveaux intermédiaires / régionaux à analyser et relier les données des systèmes de surveillance en temps réel renforcés, y compris les systèmes interopérables. Les pays soutiendront l'utilisation de systèmes interopérables et interconnectés capables de lier et d'intégrer des données de surveillance multisectorielles et d'utiliser les informations obtenues pour renforcer la capacité de détecter et de réagir rapidement aux menaces biologiques en développement. La capacité de base est nécessaire à la fois pour la surveillance basée sur les indicateurs (y compris syndromique) et la surveillance événementielle, afin de soutenir les activités de prévention et de contrôle et le ciblage des interventions pour les maladies infectieuses et menaces sanitaires établies et émergentes. Une surveillance étroite permettra de reconnaître rapidement l'émergence de pathogènes relativement rares ou non décrits dans certains pays.
capacities.desired_impact_en: A functioning public health surveillance system capable of identifying potential events of concern for public health and health security, and country and intermediate level/regional capacity to analyse and link data from and between strengthened real-time surveillance systems, including interoperable, interconnected electronic reporting systems. Countries will support the use of interoperable, interconnected systems capable of linking and integrating multi-sectoral surveillance data and using resulting information to enhance the capacity to quickly detect and respond to developing biological threats. Foundational capacity is necessary for both indicator based (including syndromic) surveillance and event-based surveillance, in order to support prevention and control activities and intervention targeting for both established infectious diseases and new and emerging public health threats. Strong surveillance will support the timely recognition of the emergence of relatively rare or previously undescribed pathogens in specific countries.
capacities.notes_fr: L'indicateur fait référence à la capacité de surveillance du pays. Le système de surveillance en temps réel doit inclure la capacité de surveiller au moins trois syndromes de base indiquant une urgence sanitaire, la capacité de fournir des rapports et des données à des décisions de santé publique de haut niveau. La surveillance basée sur les événements est la capture organisée et rapide des informations sur les événements qui constituent un risque potentiel pour la santé publique. Ces informations peuvent être des rumeurs et d'autres rapports ad hoc transmis par des canaux formels (à savoir des systèmes de rapports de routine établis) et informels (médias, agents de santé et rapports d'organisations non gouvernementales) et peuvent compléter la surveillance syndromique traditionnelle.
capacities.notes_en: The indicator refers to surveillance capacity for the country.,The real-time surveillance system should include the ability to conduct surveillance for at least three core syndromes indicative of a public health emergency, the ability to provide reports and data to high level public health decision makers in country, and feedback to lower levels implementing control programs, and the linkages to laboratory and other information systems to provide a complete surveillance picture,Event-based surveillance is the organized and rapid capture of information about events that are a potential risk to public health. This information can be rumours and other ad-hoc reports transmitted through formal channels (i.e. established routine reporting systems) and informal channels (i.e. media, health workers and nongovernmental organizations reports) and can supplement traditional syndromic surveillance.

capacities.name: Reporting
capacities.target_description: Timely and accurate disease reporting according to WHO requirements and consistent coordination with FAO and OIE.
capacities.as_measured_by: Number of countries trained for reporting of potential public health events of international concern to WHO and to other official reporting systems such as OIE-WAHIS. (and/or) Number of National IHR Focal Points connected to the learning package on reporting to WHO.
capacities.desired_impact: Countries and their National IHR Focal Points, OIE Delegates, and WAHIS National Focal Points will have access to a toolkit of best practices, model procedures, reporting templates, and training materials to facilitate rapid (within 24 hours) notification of events that may constitute a PHEIC to WHO / listed diseases to OIE and will be able to rapidly (within 24/48 hours) respond to communications from these organizations.
capacities.notes: Not all countries will have reported a potential PHEIC to the WHO or reported to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease,NOTE: all questions should be answered to reflect human and zoonotic animal diseases

indicators.name: System for efficient reporting to WHO, FAO and OIE

score_descriptions.1: No national IHR focal point, OIE Delegate and/or WAHIS National Focal Point has been identified and / or identified focal point/delegate does not have access to learning package and best practices as provided by WHO, OIE and FAO.
score_descriptions.2: Country has identified National IHR Focal Point, OIE delegates and WAHIS National Focal Points; focal point is linked to learning package and best practices as provided by WHO, OIE and FAO
score_descriptions.3: Country has demonstrated ability to identify a potential PHEIC and file a report to WHO based on an exercise or real event, and similarly to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease
score_descriptions.4: Country has demonstrated ability to identify a potential PHEIC and file a report to WHO within 24 hours and similarly to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease, based on an exercise or real event
score_descriptions.5: Country has demonstrated ability to identify a potential PHEIC and file a report within 24 hours, and similarly to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease, and has a multisectoral process in place for assessing potential events for reporting

indicators.name_fr: Système de notification efficace à l'OMS, à la FAO et à l'OIE
indicators.name_en: System for efficient reporting to WHO, FAO and OIE

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun point focal national RSI, Délégué de l'OIE et / ou point focal national WAHIS n'a été identifié et / ou point focal /délégué identifié n'a accès au module d'apprentissage et aux meilleures pratiques fournies par l'OMS, l'OIE et la FAO.
score_descriptions_fr.2: Le pays a identifié le point focal national du RSI, les délégués de l'OIE et les points focaux nationaux du WAHIS; Le point focal est lié au programme d'apprentissage et aux meilleures pratiques fournis par l'OMS, l'OIE et la FAO.
score_descriptions_fr.3: Le pays a démontré sa capacité à identifier une éventuelle USPPI et à présenter un rapport à l'OMS sur la base d'un exercice ou d'un événement réel, et de manière similaire à l'OIE pour les zoonoses pertinentes
score_descriptions_fr.4: Le pays a démontré sa capacité à identifier une USPPI potentielle et à déposer un rapport à l'OMS dans les 24 heures et de manière similaire à l'OIE pour les zoonoses pertinentes, sur la base d'un exercice ou d'un événement réel
score_descriptions_fr.5: Le pays a démontré sa capacité à identifier une USPPI potentielle et à déposer un rapport dans les 24 heures, de même à l'OIE pour les zoonoses pertinentes, et a mis en place un processus multisectoriel pour évaluer les événements potentiels à signaler

score_descriptions_en.1: No national IHR focal point, OIE Delegate and/or WAHIS National Focal Point has been identified and / or identified focal point/delegate does not have access to learning package and best practices as provided by WHO, OIE and FAO.
score_descriptions_en.2: Country has identified National IHR Focal Point, OIE delegates and WAHIS National Focal Points; focal point is linked to learning package and best practices as provided by WHO, OIE and FAO
score_descriptions_en.3: Country has demonstrated ability to identify a potential PHEIC and file a report to WHO based on an exercise or real event, and similarly to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease
score_descriptions_en.4: Country has demonstrated ability to identify a potential PHEIC and file a report to WHO within 24 hours and similarly to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease, based on an exercise or real event
score_descriptions_en.5: Country has demonstrated ability to identify a potential PHEIC and file a report within 24 hours, and similarly to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease, and has a multisectoral process in place for assessing potential events for reporting

indicators.name: Reporting network and protocols in country

score_descriptions.1: Country does not have protocols or processes for reporting to WHO, OIE or FAO; does not have plans to establish within the next year plans and protocols for reporting
score_descriptions.2: Country is in the process of developing and establishing protocols, processes, regulations, and/or legislation governing reporting to start implementation within a year.
score_descriptions.3: Country has established protocols, processes, regulations, and/or legislation governing reporting and processes for multisectoral coordination in response to a potential PHEIC to WHO and to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease.
score_descriptions.4: Country demonstrates timely reporting of a potential PHEIC to WHO and to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease in alignment with national and international standards in selected intermediate levels (districts or regions), based on an exercise or real event.
score_descriptions.5: Country demonstrates timely reporting of a potential PHEIC to the WHO from district to national and international level and to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease (based on an exercise or real event); country has a sustainable process for maintaining and improving reporting and communication capabilities and communication mechanisms are backed by established documentation (e.g. protocols, regulations, legislation.)

Comprend la location d'installations, la papeterie, les rafraîchissements et autres frais accessoires.

indicators.name_fr: Réseau de notification et de protocoles dans le pays
indicators.name_en: Reporting network and protocols in country

score_descriptions_fr.1: Le pays ne dispose pas de protocoles ou de processus de notification à l'OMS, à l'OIE ou à la FAO; n'a pas l'intention d'établir dans l'année à venir des plans et des protocoles pour les rapports
score_descriptions_fr.2: Le pays est en train d'élaborer et d'établir des protocoles, des processus, des règlements et / ou des lois régissant les rapports pour débuter leurs mises en œuvre d'ici un an.
score_descriptions_fr.3: Le pays a établi des protocoles, des processus, des réglementations et / ou des législations régissant les rapports et les processus de coordination multisectorielle en réponse à une éventuelle USPPI pour l'OMS et à l'OIE pour les zoonoses pertinentes.
score_descriptions_fr.4: Le pays présente à l'OMS et à l'OIE des rapports en temps opportun sur les risques potentiels de zoonose correspondant aux normes nationales et internationales dans certains niveaux intermédiaires (districts ou régions), sur la base d'un exercice ou d'un événement réel.
score_descriptions_fr.5: Le pays présente à l'OMS, de district à niveau national et international, et à l'OIE, des rapports ponctuels d'une éventuelle USPPI pour les maladies zoonotiques pertinentes (sur la base d'un exercice ou d'un événement réel); le pays dispose d'un processus durable pour maintenir et améliorer les capacités de communication et les mécanismes de communication s'appuient sur une documentation établie (par exemple, protocoles, réglementations, législation).

score_descriptions_en.1: Country does not have protocols or processes for reporting to WHO, OIE or FAO; does not have plans to establish within the next year plans and protocols for reporting
score_descriptions_en.2: Country is in the process of developing and establishing protocols, processes, regulations, and/or legislation governing reporting to start implementation within a year.
score_descriptions_en.3: Country has established protocols, processes, regulations, and/or legislation governing reporting and processes for multisectoral coordination in response to a potential PHEIC to WHO and to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease.
score_descriptions_en.4: Country demonstrates timely reporting of a potential PHEIC to WHO and to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease in alignment with national and international standards in selected intermediate levels (districts or regions), based on an exercise or real event.
score_descriptions_en.5: Country demonstrates timely reporting of a potential PHEIC to the WHO from district to national and international level and to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease (based on an exercise or real event); country has a sustainable process for maintaining and improving reporting and communication capabilities and communication mechanisms are backed by established documentation (e.g. protocols, regulations, legislation.)

capacities.target_description_fr: Déclaration rapide et précise des maladies conformément aux exigences de l'OMS et coordination cohérente avec la FAO et l'OIE.
capacities.target_description_en: Timely and accurate disease reporting according to WHO requirements and consistent coordination with FAO and OIE.
capacities.as_measured_by_en: Number of countries trained for reporting of potential public health events of international concern to WHO and to other official reporting systems such as OIE-WAHIS. (and/or) Number of National IHR Focal Points connected to the learning package on reporting to WHO.
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Les pays et leurs points focaux nationaux RSI, les délégués OIE et les points focaux nationaux WAHIS auront accès à une boîte à outils de bonnes pratiques, de procédures modèles, de modèles de rapports et de matériel de formation pour faciliter la notification rapide (dans les 24 heures) faisant l'objet d'un USPPI pour les maladies de l'OMS / listées à l'OIE et seront en mesure de répondre rapidement (dans les 24/48 heures) aux communications de ces organisations.
capacities.desired_impact_en: Countries and their National IHR Focal Points, OIE Delegates, and WAHIS National Focal Points will have access to a toolkit of best practices, model procedures, reporting templates, and training materials to facilitate rapid (within 24 hours) notification of events that may constitute a PHEIC to WHO / listed diseases to OIE and will be able to rapidly (within 24/48 hours) respond to communications from these organizations.
capacities.notes_fr: Pas tous les pays n'auront signalé une éventuelle USPPI à l'OMS ou signalé à l'OIE une maladie zoonotique pertinente. REMARQUE: toutes les questions doivent être répondues pour refléter les maladies animales, humaines et zoonotiques
capacities.notes_en: Not all countries will have reported a potential PHEIC to the WHO or reported to the OIE for relevant zoonotic disease,NOTE: all questions should be answered to reflect human and zoonotic animal diseases

capacities.name: Workforce Development
capacities.target_description: State parties should have skilled and competent health personnel for sustainable and functional public health surveillance and response at all levels of the health system and the effective implementation of the IHR (2005). A workforce includes physicians, animal health or veterinarians, biostatisticians, laboratory scientists, farming/livestock professionals, with an optimal target of one trained field epidemiologist (or equivalent) per 200,000 population, who can systematically cooperate to meet relevant IHR and PVS core competencies.
capacities.as_measured_by: A workforce including physicians, animal health or veterinarians, biostatisticians, laboratory scientists, farming/livestock professionals, with an optimal target of one trained field epidemiologist (or equivalent) per 200,000 population, who can systematically cooperate to meet relevant IHR and PVS core competencies.
capacities.desired_impact: Prevention, detection, and response activities conducted effectively and sustainably by a fully competent, coordinated, evaluated and occupationally diverse multi-sectoral workforce.
capacities.notes: The indicator refers to public health workforce capacity for the country. Public health workforce planning should include: epidemiologists, biostatisticians, information systems specialists, veterinarians, and other public health personnel; indication of trainings that have been provided at a national level or are available to staff from a partner entity; description of long-term training programs that are available to help expand the pipeline of qualified public health professionals within the country. FETP Basic Level Training: For local health staff, it consists of limited classroom hours interspersed throughout 3–5 month on the job field assignments to build capacity in conducting timely outbreak detection, public health response, and public health surveillance. FETP Intermediate Level Training: For intermediate levels (district/regions) epidemiologists, it consists of limited classroom hours interspersed throughout 6- 9 month on the job mentored field assignments to build capacity in conducting outbreak investigations, planned epidemiologic studies, and public health surveillance analyses and evaluations. FETP Advanced Level Training: with a national focus for advanced epidemiologists, it consists of limited classroom hours interspersed throughout 24-month mentored field assignments to build capacity in outbreak investigations, planned epidemiologic studies, public health surveillance analyses and evaluations, scientific communication and evidence-based decision making for development of effective public health programming. Workforce development is a crosscutting element, and many other aspects of IHR implementation will depend on strong public health workforce.

indicators.name: Human resources are available to implement IHR core capacity requirements

score_descriptions.1: Country doesn’t have multidisciplinary HR capacity required for implementation of IHR core capacities
score_descriptions.2: Country has multidisciplinary HR capacity (epidemiologists, veterinarians, clinicians and laboratory specialists or technicians) at national level
score_descriptions.3: Multidisciplinary HR capacity is available at national and intermediate level
score_descriptions.4: Multidisciplinary HR capacity is available as required at relevant levels of public health system (e.g. epidemiologist at national level and intermediate level and assistance epidemiologist (or short course trained epidemiologist) at local level available)
score_descriptions.5: Country has capacity to send and receive multidisciplinary personnel within country (shifting resources) and internationally

line_items.name: Workshop expenditures
line_items.description: Expenses for 4 small, 1-day, national outreach workshops to engage academic/university partners, ministry of education, and other human/animal health stakeholders in establishing HR multidisciplinary workforce for IHR implementation according to national plans/National Strategic Plan. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.
line_items.function_tag: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references: Equivalent of 1 full-day workshop including paid conference venue, refreshments and stationery. Assume SMALL NATIONAL meeting (see worksheet).  Default = 4 small meeting at $600/meeting.
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Conference costs: determine per person costs for full-day workshop based on local conference rates (refreshments, stationery, incidentals, and venue) at NATIONAL LEVEL. Multiply by the number of participants to determine the per workshop cost, and adjust the base multiplier (number of workshops) as needed.
line_items.description_fr: Dépenses pour 4 petits ateliers nationaux de sensibilisation pour impliquer les partenaires académiques / universitaires, le ministère de l'éducation et d'autres acteurs de la santé humaine / animale dans la mise en place de ressources humaines multidisciplinaires pour la mise en œuvre du RSI conformément aux plans nationaux / plan stratégique national. Comprend la location d'installations, la papeterie, les rafraîchissements et autres frais accessoires.
line_items.description_en: Expenses for 4 small, 1-day, national outreach workshops to engage academic/university partners, ministry of education, and other human/animal health stakeholders in establishing HR multidisciplinary workforce for IHR implementation according to national plans/National Strategic Plan. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.
line_items.function_tag_fr: Planification incluant l'évaluation, la conception, la planification, la réglementation, la législation
line_items.function_tag_en: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references_fr: Équivalent d'un atelier d'une journée comprenant un lieu de conférence payant, des rafraîchissements et de la papeterie. Présumer une réunion NATIONALE PETITE (voir fiche de travail). Par défaut = 4 petites réunions à 600 $ / réunion.
line_items.references_en: Equivalent of 1 full-day workshop including paid conference venue, refreshments and stationery. Assume SMALL NATIONAL meeting (see worksheet).  Default = 4 small meeting at $600/meeting.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_fr: Coûts de conférence: déterminer les coûts par personne pour un atelier d'une journée basé sur les tarifs des conférences locales (rafraîchissements, papeterie, frais accessoires et salle) au NIVEAU NATIONAL. Multiplier par le nombre de participants pour déterminer le coût par atelier, et ajuster le multiplicateur de base (nombre d'ateliers) selon les besoins.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_en: Conference costs: determine per person costs for full-day workshop based on local conference rates (refreshments, stationery, incidentals, and venue) at NATIONAL LEVEL. Multiply by the number of participants to determine the per workshop cost, and adjust the base multiplier (number of workshops) as needed.

line_items.name: Workshop expenditures
line_items.description: Expenses for 2 small, 5-day, national planning workshops  to develop instructional strategies for formal training programs (university curricula and/or continuing education programs) in relevant One Health disciplines - assume a minimum of one workshop each for human and animal health. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.
line_items.function_tag: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references: Equivalent of 1 full-day workshop including paid conference venue, refreshments and stationery. Assume SMALL NATIONAL meeting (see worksheet).  Default = 2 5-day  small meeting days at $600/meeting day.
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Conference costs: determine per person costs for full-day workshop based on local conference rates (refreshments, stationery, incidentals, and venue) at NATIONAL LEVEL. Multiply by the number of participants to determine the per workshop cost, and adjust the base multiplier (number of workshops) as needed.
line_items.description_fr: Dépenses pour 2 petits ateliers nationaux de planification de 5 jours pour élaborer des stratégies pédagogiques pour les programmes de formation officiels (programmes universitaires et / ou programmes de formation continue) dans les disciplines One Health concernées – en supposant au moins un atelier sur la santé humaine et animale. Comprend la location d'installations, la papeterie, les rafraîchissements et autres frais accessoires.
line_items.description_en: Expenses for 2 small, 5-day, national planning workshops  to develop instructional strategies for formal training programs (university curricula and/or continuing education programs) in relevant One Health disciplines - assume a minimum of one workshop each for human and animal health. Includes facility rental, stationary, refreshments, and other incidentals.

inputs.name_fr: Tenir des ateliers de planification pour élaborer des stratégies pédagogiques pour soutenir la formation du personnel de One Health

inputs.name: Hold planning workshops to develop instructional strategies to support One Health-relevant training

line_items.name: Workshop per diems
line_items.description: Per diems for 2 small, 5-day, national planning workshops  to develop instructional strategies for formal training programs (university curricula and/or continuing education programs) in relevant One Health disciplines - assume a minimum of one workshop each for human and animal health
line_items.function_tag: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references: Assumes national daily travel allowance (at national rate) for each day x equivalent of 2 five-day workshops x 10 participants each. Default per diem = $105 per person per day, based on WHO-CHOICE National-Level Per Diem in USD2017.
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Per diem: use daily rates set by national regulations OR use WHO/UN rates (http://apps.who.int/bfi/tsy/PerDiem.aspx) or WHO-CHOICE rates and adjust the base multiplier (number of participants eligible for per diem x number of days) as needed.
line_items.description_fr: Per diem pour 2 petits ateliers nationaux de planification de 5 jours pour développer des stratégies pédagogiques pour les programmes de formation formelle (cursus universitaires et / ou programmes de formation continue) dans les disciplines One Health concernées – en supposant au moins un atelier pour la santé humaine et animale
line_items.description_en: Per diems for 2 small, 5-day, national planning workshops  to develop instructional strategies for formal training programs (university curricula and/or continuing education programs) in relevant One Health disciplines - assume a minimum of one workshop each for human and animal health
line_items.function_tag_fr: Planification incluant l'évaluation, la conception, la planification, la réglementation, la législation
line_items.function_tag_en: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references_fr: Présumer une indemnité journalière de déplacement (au taux national) pour chaque jour x équivalent de 2 ateliers de cinq jours x 10 participants chacun. Per diem par défaut = 105 dollars par personne et par jour, sur la base des per diem de niveau national WHO-CHOICE en USD2017.
line_items.references_en: Assumes national daily travel allowance (at national rate) for each day x equivalent of 2 five-day workshops x 10 participants each. Default per diem = $105 per person per day, based on WHO-CHOICE National-Level Per Diem in USD2017.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_fr: Per diem: utiliser les taux quotidiens fixés par les réglementations nationales OU utiliser les taux OMS / ONU (<http://apps.who.int/bfi/tsy/PerDiem.aspx>) ou les taux WHO-CHOICE et ajuster le multiplicateur de base (nombre de participants admissibles à un nombre quotidien de jours) selon au besoin.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_en: Per diem: use daily rates set by national regulations OR use WHO/UN rates (http://apps.who.int/bfi/tsy/PerDiem.aspx) or WHO-CHOICE rates and adjust the base multiplier (number of participants eligible for per diem x number of days) as needed.

inputs.name: Develop course contents for One Health-relevant training

line_items.name: Training specialist compensation
line_items.description: Three months of salary for 1 training specialist to develop course content (lesson plans, participant materials, training aids) for formal training programs (university curricula and/or continuing education programs) in relevant One Health disciplines
line_items.references: Equivalent of 3 months' (0.25 years) full-time work by salaried educator/training expert.
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Salary per year: enter the average cost of the appropriate level public health professional according to your national wage schedule and adujst base multiplier (months expressed as fraction of years).
line_items.description_fr: Trois mois de salaire pour 1 spécialiste de la formation pour développer le contenu des cours (plans de cours, matériel pour les participants, aides à la formation) pour les programmes de formation formelle (cursus universitaires et / ou programmes de formation continue) dans les disciplines One Health
line_items.description_en: Three months of salary for 1 training specialist to develop course content (lesson plans, participant materials, training aids) for formal training programs (university curricula and/or continuing education programs) in relevant One Health disciplines
line_items.function_tag_fr: Opérations / mise en œuvre
line_items.references_fr: Équivalent de 3 mois (0,25 années) de travail à plein temps par un éducateur salarié / expert en formation.
line_items.references_en: Equivalent of 3 months' (0.25 years) full-time work by salaried educator/training expert.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_fr: Salaire par année: entrer le coût moyen du professionnel de la santé publique de niveau approprié en fonction de la grille salariale nationale et ajuster avec le multiplicateur de base (mois exprimés en fraction d'années).
line_items.where_find_base_cost_en: Salary per year: enter the average cost of the appropriate level public health professional according to your national wage schedule and adujst base multiplier (months expressed as fraction of years).

inputs.name_fr: Développer le contenu des cours pour une formation pertinente à One Health

actions.name_fr: Soutenir les initiatives de formation et d'éducation pour élargir le personnel de One Health
actions.name_en: Support training and education initiatives to expand One Health workforce

indicators.name_fr: Des ressources humaines sont disponibles pour mettre en œuvre les exigences de capacité de base du RSI
indicators.name_en: Human resources are available to implement IHR core capacity requirements

score_descriptions_fr.1: Le pays n'a pas de capacité RH multidisciplinaire requise pour la mise en œuvre des capacités de base du RSI
score_descriptions_fr.2: Le pays a une capacité multidisciplinaire en ressources humaines (épidémiologistes, vétérinaires, cliniciens et spécialistes ou techniciens de laboratoire) au niveau national
score_descriptions_fr.3: La capacité multidisciplinaire en ressources humaines est disponible aux niveaux national et intermédiaire
score_descriptions_fr.4: Une capacité multidisciplinaire en ressources humaines est disponible selon les besoins aux niveaux pertinents du système de santé publique (par exemple épidémiologiste au niveau national et niveau intermédiaire, et assistant épidémiologiste (ou épidémiologiste de formation courte) au niveau local sont disponibles)
score_descriptions_fr.5: Le pays a la capacité d'envoyer et de recevoir du personnel multidisciplinaire dans le pays (transfert de ressources) et à l'échelle internationale.

score_descriptions_en.1: Country doesn’t have multidisciplinary HR capacity required for implementation of IHR core capacities
score_descriptions_en.2: Country has multidisciplinary HR capacity (epidemiologists, veterinarians, clinicians and laboratory specialists or technicians) at national level
score_descriptions_en.3: Multidisciplinary HR capacity is available at national and intermediate level
score_descriptions_en.4: Multidisciplinary HR capacity is available as required at relevant levels of public health system (e.g. epidemiologist at national level and intermediate level and assistance epidemiologist (or short course trained epidemiologist) at local level available)
score_descriptions_en.5: Country has capacity to send and receive multidisciplinary personnel within country (shifting resources) and internationally

indicators.name: Applied epidemiology training program in place such as FETP

score_descriptions.1: No FETP or applied epidemiology training program established
score_descriptions.2: No FETP or applied epidemiology training program is established within the country, but staff participate in a program hosted in another country through an existing agreement (at Basic, Intermediate and/or Advanced level)
score_descriptions.3: One level of FETP (Basic, Intermediate, or Advanced) FETP or comparable applied epidemiology training program in place in the country or in another country through an existing agreement
score_descriptions.4: Two levels of FETP (Basic, Intermediate and/or Advanced) or comparable applied epidemiology training program(s) in place in the country or in another country through an existing agreement
score_descriptions.5: Three levels of FETP (Basic, Intermediate and Advanced) or comparable applied epidemiology training program(s) in place in the country or in another country through an existing agreement, with sustainable national funding
