inputs.name_fr: Tenir régulièrement des réunions de communication et de coordination au niveau intermédiaire

actions.name_fr: Mettre en œuvre un plan de coordination de la communication au niveau intermédiaire
actions.name_en: Implement communication coordination plan at the intermediate level

indicators.name_fr: Communication et coordination internes et avec les partenaires
indicators.name_en: Internal and Partner Communication and Coordination

score_descriptions_fr.1: Pas de plateforme de coordination et de mécanismes de communication interne et de partenariat pour impliquer les principales parties prenantes nationales, intermédiaires, locales et internationales (y compris les agents de santé)
score_descriptions_fr.2: Coordination faible de communication ad hoc telle que des réunions avec certains partenaires et / ou un partage d'informations irrégulier
score_descriptions_fr.3: La coordination de la communication existe mais avec un engagement limité des partenaires et des parties prenantes, y compris lesagent de santé, les organisations de la société civile, le secteur privé et d'autres acteurs non étatiques
score_descriptions_fr.4: Une coordination de communication efficace et régulière avec tous les partenaires requis par tous les niveaux précédents est en place, et testée par un exercice de simulation ou testée par une véritable urgence sanitaire
score_descriptions_fr.5: Une coordination de la communication efficace, régulière et inclusive avec les partenaires et les parties prenantes est en place, y compris la définition des rôles, le partage des ressources et les plans d'action conjoints

score_descriptions_en.1: No coordination platform and mechanisms for internal and partner communication for engaging key national, intermediate, local and international stakeholders (including health care workers)
score_descriptions_en.2: Some ad hoc communication coordination such as meetings with some partners and/or irregular information-sharing
score_descriptions_en.3: Communication coordination exists but with limited partner and stakeholder engagement including health care workers, civil society organizations, private sector and other non-state actors
score_descriptions_en.4: Effective, regular communication coordination with all partners required by all preceding levels, and their coordination tested by a simulation exercise or tested by a real health emergency
score_descriptions_en.5: Effective, regular and inclusive communication coordination with partners and stakeholders including definition of roles, sharing of resources and joint action plans

indicators.name: Public Communication

score_descriptions.1: No central unit or locus for public communication, reactive, ad hoc media outreach
score_descriptions.2: Public communication unit or team exists, government spokesperson identified and trained, procedures for public communication in place
score_descriptions.3: Level 2 (limited capacity) plus proactive public outreach on a mix of platforms (newspapers, radio, TV, social media, web) as appropriate according to national and local preferences; and in relevant national and local languages and otherwise understandable to populations. Use of locally relevant technologies for public communications (mobile phones, etc.)
score_descriptions.4: There is planned communication with continuous engagement and proactive media outreach (including regular media briefings) guided by risk communication best practices and achieves comprehensive geographical coverage, evidenced by regular coverage of health issues and risks in relevant languages; as well as by media and social media activity during an emergency
score_descriptions.5: The government, partners and diverse media outlets are engaged in robust and increasingly responsive collaboration to provide health advice, including addressing people’s concerns and rumours; and address misinformation

actions.name_en: Incorporate best practices into public communications

indicators.name_fr: Communication publique
indicators.name_en: Public Communication

score_descriptions_fr.1: Pas d'unité centrale ou de lieu pour la communication publique, réactive, pour une sensibilisation ad hoc des médias
score_descriptions_fr.2: Une unité de communication publique ou équipe est existante, un porte-parole du gouvernement identifié et formé, des procédures de communication publique en place
score_descriptions_fr.3: Niveau 2 (capacité limitée) et sensibilisation proactive du public sur un éventail de plateformes (journaux, radio, télévision, médias sociaux, web) selon les préférences nationales et locales; et dans les langues nationales et locales pertinentes et autrement compréhensible pour les populations. Utilisation de technologies pertinentes au niveau local pour les communications publiques (téléphones mobiles, etc.)
score_descriptions_fr.4: Communication planifiée avec un engagement continu et une sensibilisation proactive des médias (y compris des réunions d'information régulières) guidée par les meilleures pratiques de communication sur les risques et une couverture géographique complète, attestée par une couverture régulière des problèmes de santé et des risques dans les langues pertinentes ; ainsi que par les médias et les médias sociaux lors d'une situation d'urgence
score_descriptions_fr.5: Le gouvernement, les partenaires et les divers médias sont engagés dans une collaboration robuste et de plus en plus réactive pour fournir des conseils de santé, y compris en répondant aux préoccupations et aux rumeurs des gens ; et traite la désinformation

score_descriptions_en.1: No central unit or locus for public communication, reactive, ad hoc media outreach
score_descriptions_en.2: Public communication unit or team exists, government spokesperson identified and trained, procedures for public communication in place
score_descriptions_en.3: Level 2 (limited capacity) plus proactive public outreach on a mix of platforms (newspapers, radio, TV, social media, web) as appropriate according to national and local preferences; and in relevant national and local languages and otherwise understandable to populations. Use of locally relevant technologies for public communications (mobile phones, etc.)
score_descriptions_en.4: There is planned communication with continuous engagement and proactive media outreach (including regular media briefings) guided by risk communication best practices and achieves comprehensive geographical coverage, evidenced by regular coverage of health issues and risks in relevant languages; as well as by media and social media activity during an emergency
score_descriptions_en.5: The government, partners and diverse media outlets are engaged in robust and increasingly responsive collaboration to provide health advice, including addressing people’s concerns and rumours; and address misinformation

indicators.name: Communication Engagement with Aﬀected Communities

score_descriptions.1: No arrangement exists to systematically engage populations at community level for emergencies. There may be social mobilization, health promotion or community engagement on health risks for maternal child health, immunization, malaria, TB and HIV/AIDS, polio, NTDs and other developmental programmes but these are not systematically used for emergencies
score_descriptions.2: Community level engagement system is semi-formed with mapping of existing processes, programmes, partners and stakeholders. Social mobilization, behaviour change communication and community engagement are included in the national risk communication strategy in the context of health emergencies. Some key stakeholders in this domain are identified at national and intermediate (provincial/regional) level
score_descriptions.3: Stakeholders mapped at intermediate and local levels, decentralized system (including financial and human resources) in place for community engagement involving community and religious leaders, community based organisations (CBOs), and other decentralized teams. Standard practice of developing information education communication (IEC) materials with the involvement of community and key stakeholders. Community consultation mechanisms are in place (e.g. hotline, surveys, etc.)
score_descriptions.4: Regular briefing, training and engagement of social mobilization and community engagement teams including volunteers. Mechanisms to harness scale up capacity exist and are operational. Feedback loop from listening (Domain 5) into community engagement is operational
score_descriptions.5: Communities are equal partners in risk communication process as evidenced by the review of a simulation exercise or tested by a real health emergency

actions.name_fr: Examiner et mettre à jour la stratégie d'engagement au niveau communautaire
actions.name_en: Review and update community level engagement strategy

indicators.name_fr: Communication pour faire participer les communautés touchées
indicators.name_en: Communication Engagement with Aﬀected Communities

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun arrangement n'existe pour engager systématiquement les populations au niveau communautaire en cas d'urgence. Il peut y avoir une mobilisation sociale, une promotion de la santé ou un engagement communautaire sur les risques pour la santé maternelle, la vaccination, le paludisme, la tuberculose et le VIH / SIDA, la poliomyélite, les maladies tropicales négligées et d'autres programmes de développement, mais ils ne sont pas systématiquement utilisés lors d'urgences
score_descriptions_fr.2: Le système d'engagement au niveau communautaire est semi-formé avec la cartographie des processus, programmes, partenaires et parties prenantes existants. La mobilisation sociale, la communication sur le changement de comportement et l'engagement communautaire sont inclus dans la stratégie nationale de communication sur les risques dans le contexte des urgences sanitaires. Certaines parties prenantes clés dans ce domaine sont identifiées au niveau national et intermédiaire (provincial / régional)
score_descriptions_fr.3: Les parties prenantes sont cartographiées aux niveaux intermédiaire et local, le système décentralisé (y compris les ressources financières et humaines) est en place pour l'engagement communautaire impliquant les leaders communautaires et religieux, les organisations communautaires (CBO), et d'autres équipes décentralisées. Pratique standard de développement de matériel d'information, d'éducation et de communication (IEC) avec la participation de la communauté et des principales parties prenantes. Des mécanismes de consultation communautaire sont en place (hotline, enquêtes, etc.)
score_descriptions_fr.4: Séances d'information régulières, formation et mobilisation des équipes de mobilisation sociale et d'engagement communautaire, y compris des bénévoles. Des mécanismes pour exploiter la capacité d'extension existent et sont opérationnels. La boucle de rétroaction de l'écoute (Domaine 5) vers l'engagement communautaire est opérationnelle
score_descriptions_fr.5: Les communautés sont des partenaires égaux dans le processus de communication sur les risques tel que démontré par l'examen d'un exercice de simulation ou testé par une véritable urgence sanitaire

score_descriptions_en.1: No arrangement exists to systematically engage populations at community level for emergencies. There may be social mobilization, health promotion or community engagement on health risks for maternal child health, immunization, malaria, TB and HIV/AIDS, polio, NTDs and other developmental programmes but these are not systematically used for emergencies
score_descriptions_en.2: Community level engagement system is semi-formed with mapping of existing processes, programmes, partners and stakeholders. Social mobilization, behaviour change communication and community engagement are included in the national risk communication strategy in the context of health emergencies. Some key stakeholders in this domain are identified at national and intermediate (provincial/regional) level
score_descriptions_en.3: Stakeholders mapped at intermediate and local levels, decentralized system (including financial and human resources) in place for community engagement involving community and religious leaders, community based organisations (CBOs), and other decentralized teams. Standard practice of developing information education communication (IEC) materials with the involvement of community and key stakeholders. Community consultation mechanisms are in place (e.g. hotline, surveys, etc.)
score_descriptions_en.4: Regular briefing, training and engagement of social mobilization and community engagement teams including volunteers. Mechanisms to harness scale up capacity exist and are operational. Feedback loop from listening (Domain 5) into community engagement is operational
score_descriptions_en.5: Communities are equal partners in risk communication process as evidenced by the review of a simulation exercise or tested by a real health emergency

indicators.name: Dynamic Listening and Rumour Management

score_descriptions.1: No system exists to identify or response to rumours, and misinformation; nor to understand and analyse public concerns and fears
score_descriptions.2: Ad hoc systems for listening and rumour management, including through health care workers, but not fully used to guide the response
score_descriptions.3: Routine and event-based systems for listening and rumour management or ongoing system with limited or unpredictable influence on the response
score_descriptions.4: Strong system for listening and rumour management on a permanent basis which is integrated into the decision-making and response actions for public communications (Domain 3), communication engagement with affected communities (Domain 4), as well as for internal and partners communications (Domain 2)
score_descriptions.5: Misinformation and rumours have little or minimum traction because risk communication is effective; the public(s) trust official health advice; and desired behaviour change is evidenced where appropriate

actions.name: Develop plan for dynamic listening and rumour management system

inputs.name: Hire national consultant to draft plan for dynamic listening and rumour management system

line_items.name: Daily fees (total)
line_items.description: Fees for 40-days of consultant time to help draft a plan for a dynamic listening and rumour management system, including permanent integration with decision-making and response actions for public communications, communication engagement with affected communities, and internal and partners communications
line_items.function_tag: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references: Equivalent of 40 days' work by external consultant (national) for research, meetings, outreach, and travel. Default fees per day is UN Level D maximum daily rate established October 2013 (Source: ST/AI/2013/4). Default per diem is official WHO/UN per diem for Nairobi, Kenya.
line_items.where_find_base_cost: Daily rate: use UN Level D or local market daily rates for expert consultant, and adjust the number of days as needed. Per diem: use official WHO/UN per diem or local government per diem.
line_items.description_fr: Honoraires de 40 jours pour aider à rédiger un plan pour un système dynamique d'écoute et de gestion des rumeurs, incluant une intégration permanente avec les actions de prise de décision et d'intervention pour les communications publiques, la communication avec les communautés affectées et les communications internes et partenaires
line_items.description_en: Fees for 40-days of consultant time to help draft a plan for a dynamic listening and rumour management system, including permanent integration with decision-making and response actions for public communications, communication engagement with affected communities, and internal and partners communications
line_items.function_tag_fr: Planification incluant l'évaluation, la conception, la planification, la réglementation, la législation
line_items.function_tag_en: Planning including assessment, design, planning, policy, legislation
line_items.references_fr: Équivalent de 40 jours de travail par un consultant externe (national) pour la recherche, les réunions, la sensibilisation et les voyages. Les frais par jour par défaut correspondent au taux journalier maximal de niveau D des Nations Unies établi en octobre 2013 (Source: ST / AI / 2013/4). Le per diem par défaut est le per diem OMS / ONU pour Nairobi, Kenya.
line_items.references_en: Equivalent of 40 days' work by external consultant (national) for research, meetings, outreach, and travel. Default fees per day is UN Level D maximum daily rate established October 2013 (Source: ST/AI/2013/4). Default per diem is official WHO/UN per diem for Nairobi, Kenya.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_fr: Tarif par jour: utiliser les tarifs par jour de niveau D de l'ONU ou les tarifs par jour du marché local pour les consultants experts, et ajuster le nombre de jours si nécessaire. Per diem: utiliser les per diem officiels de l'OMS / ONU ou du gouvernement local.
line_items.where_find_base_cost_en: Daily rate: use UN Level D or local market daily rates for expert consultant, and adjust the number of days as needed. Per diem: use official WHO/UN per diem or local government per diem.

inputs.name_fr: Tenir une formation régulière pour le personnel de la communication des risques

actions.name_fr: Assurer une formation régulière à l'écoute dynamique et à la gestion des rumeurs
actions.name_en: Provide regular training in dynamic listening and rumour management

indicators.name_fr: Écoute dynamique et gestion des rumeurs
indicators.name_en: Dynamic Listening and Rumour Management

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun système n'existe pour identifier ou répondre aux rumeurs et à la désinformation; ni pour comprendre et analyser les préoccupations et les craintes du public
score_descriptions_fr.2: Systèmes ad hoc pour l'écoute et la gestion des rumeurs, y compris par le biais des agents de santé, mais pas entièrement utilisés pour guider l'intervention
score_descriptions_fr.3: Systèmes routiniers et événementiels pour l'écoute et la gestion des rumeurs, ou système en cours avec une influence limitée ou imprévisible sur l'intervention
score_descriptions_fr.4: Système solide d'écoute et de gestion des rumeurs en permanence intégré aux actions de décision et d'intervention aux communications publiques (Domaine 3), communication avec les communautés affectées (Domaine 4), ainsi que pour les communications internes et avec partenaires (Domaine 2)
score_descriptions_fr.5: La désinformation et les rumeurs ont une traction faible ou minimale parce que la communication sur les risques est efficace; le (s) public (s) font confiance aux conseils de santé officiels; et le changement de comportement souhaité est démontré le cas échéant

score_descriptions_en.1: No system exists to identify or response to rumours, and misinformation; nor to understand and analyse public concerns and fears
score_descriptions_en.2: Ad hoc systems for listening and rumour management, including through health care workers, but not fully used to guide the response
score_descriptions_en.3: Routine and event-based systems for listening and rumour management or ongoing system with limited or unpredictable influence on the response
score_descriptions_en.4: Strong system for listening and rumour management on a permanent basis which is integrated into the decision-making and response actions for public communications (Domain 3), communication engagement with affected communities (Domain 4), as well as for internal and partners communications (Domain 2)
score_descriptions_en.5: Misinformation and rumours have little or minimum traction because risk communication is effective; the public(s) trust official health advice; and desired behaviour change is evidenced where appropriate

capacities.target_description_fr: Les États parties devraient disposer d'une capacité de communication multiple et multiniveaux, d'échange d'informations, de conseils et d'opinions en temps réel entre experts et fonctionnaires ou personnes confrontées à une menace ou un danger pour leur survie, leur santé ou leur bien-être économique ou social afin qu'ils puissent prendre des décisions éclairées pour atténuer les effets de la menace ou du danger et prendre des mesures préventives et de protection. Cela comprend un ensemble de stratégies de communication et d'engagement, telles que la communication dans les médias et les médias sociaux, des campagnes de sensibilisation de masse, la promotion de la santé, la mobilisation sociale, l'engagement des parties prenantes et l'engagement communautaire.
capacities.target_description_en: States Parties should have risk communication capacity which is multi-level and multi-faced, real time exchange of information, advice and opinion between experts and officials or people who face a threat or hazard to their survival, health or economic or social well-being so that they can take informed decisions to mitigate the effects of the threat or hazard and take protective and preventive action. It includes a mix of communication and engagement strategies like media and social media communication, mass awareness campaigns, health promotion, social mobilization, stakeholder engagement and community engagement.
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Les entités responsables communiquent et écoutent activement les préoccupations des publics et des communautés par le biais des médias, des médias sociaux, des campagnes de sensibilisation, de la promotion de la santé, de la mobilisation sociale, de l'engagement des parties prenantes et de l'engagement communautaire pour réduire et atténuer l'impact attendu du danger sanitaire avant et après les événements de santé publique.
capacities.desired_impact_en: Responsible entities effectively communicate and actively listen and incorporate the publics’ and communities’ concerns through the media, social media, mass awareness campaigns, health promotion, social mobilization, stakeholder engagement and community engagement for increased risk awareness to reduce and mitigate the expected impact of the health hazard before during and after public health events.
capacities.notes_fr: Dans le cadre actuel de l'évaluation des capacités du RSI (2005), seul un élément des composantes clés de la communication des risques - la communication publique - a été évalué. Les éléments évalués étaient principalement axés sur les résultats des activités de communication publique. Le cadre révisé proposé ici traite des résultats de la communication sur les risques. Le cadre s'appuie sur le contenu existant de l'évaluation des capacités du RSI et s'appuie sur un «modèle logique» fondé sur des données probantes pour évaluer les résultats des communications sur les risques d'urgence élaborés conjointement par l'OMS et la Harvard School of Public Health en 2014. Le domaine 5 (Écoute dynamique et gestion des rumeurs) devrait être évalué de manière indépendante ainsi que dans les domaines 2 (communication et coordination internes et partenaires), 3 (communication publique) et 4 (communication avec les communautés affectées).
capacities.notes_en: Under the current IHR (2005) capacity assessment framework, only one element of the key components of risk communication – public communication – was assessed. The elements assessed focused predominantly on outputs of public communications activities. The revised framework proposed here addresses risk communications outcomes. The framework builds on the existing IHR capacity assessment content, and draws on an evidence-based “logic model” for evaluating emergency risk communication outcomes developed jointly by WHO and Harvard School of Public Health in 2014. Domain 5 (Dynamic listening and rumour management) should be assessed independently as well as in relation to domains 2 (Internal and partner communication and coordination), 3 (Public communication) and 4 (Communication engagement with affected communities).

capacities.name: Points of Entry (PoE)
capacities.target_description: States Parties should designate and maintain the core capacities at the international airports and ports (and where justified for public health reasons, a State Party may designate ground crossings) which implement specific public health measures required to manage a variety of public health risks.
capacities.desired_impact: Timely detection and effective response of any potential hazards that occur at PoE.

indicators.name: Routine capacities are established at PoE

score_descriptions.1: No capacity at PoE for appropriate medical services
score_descriptions.2: Designated PoE have access to appropriate medical services including diagnostic facilities for the prompt assessment and care of ill travellers and with adequate staff, equipment and premises (Annex 1B,1a)
score_descriptions.3: Designated PoE can provide access to equipment and personnel for the transport of ill travellers to an appropriate medical facility
score_descriptions.4: Inspection program to ensure safe environment at PoE facilities functioning. A functioning programme for the control of vectors and reservoirs in and near PoE exists (Annex 1b, Art. 1e)
score_descriptions.5: Trained personnel for the inspection of conveyances are available at designated PoE (Annex 1b, Art. 1c)

indicators.name: Effective Public Health Response at Points of Entry

score_descriptions.1: No National public health emergency contingency plan exists for responding to public health emergencies occurring at points of entry.
score_descriptions.2: National public health emergency contingency plan in place for responding to public health emergencies occurring at points of entry, integrated with other PH response plans, covering all relevant sectors and services at PoE developed and disseminated to all key stakeholders
score_descriptions.3: Facilities for assessing potentially contaminated/ infected travellers and animals either onsite or through liaison with local PH services available as well as facilities for the assessment and quarantine of suspect travellers
score_descriptions.4: Referral system and transport for the safe transfer of ill travellers to appropriate medical facilities in place with regular updating and testing of national public health emergency contingency plan with published reports
score_descriptions.5: Evaluation and publication of effectiveness in responding to PH Events at PoE

indicators.name_fr: Intervention efficace en santé publique aux points d'entrée
indicators.name_en: Effective Public Health Response at Points of Entry

score_descriptions_fr.1: Il n'existe aucun plan national d'urgence en matière de santé publique pour intervenir aux urgences sanitaires survenant aux points d'entrée.
score_descriptions_fr.2: Plan national d'urgence en santé publique en place pour répondre aux urgences sanitaires se produisant aux points d'entrée, intégré avec les autres plans d'intervention de santé publique, couvrant tous les secteurs et services pertinents aux Points d'Entrée développés et diffusés à toutes les parties prenantes clés
score_descriptions_fr.3: Installations permettant d'évaluer les voyageurs et les animaux potentiellement contaminés / infectés sur place ou en liaison avec les services de santé publique locaux disponibles, ainsi que des installations pour l'évaluation et la mise en quarantaine des voyageurs suspects
score_descriptions_fr.4: Système de référence et de transport pour le transfert en toute sécurité des voyageurs malades vers des structures médicales appropriées, avec mise à jour régulière et test du plan d'urgence national en matière de santé publique avec des rapports publiés
score_descriptions_fr.5: Évaluation et publication de l'efficacité dans l'intervention aux événements de santé publique aux Points d'Entrée

score_descriptions_en.1: No National public health emergency contingency plan exists for responding to public health emergencies occurring at points of entry.
score_descriptions_en.2: National public health emergency contingency plan in place for responding to public health emergencies occurring at points of entry, integrated with other PH response plans, covering all relevant sectors and services at PoE developed and disseminated to all key stakeholders
score_descriptions_en.3: Facilities for assessing potentially contaminated/ infected travellers and animals either onsite or through liaison with local PH services available as well as facilities for the assessment and quarantine of suspect travellers
score_descriptions_en.4: Referral system and transport for the safe transfer of ill travellers to appropriate medical facilities in place with regular updating and testing of national public health emergency contingency plan with published reports
score_descriptions_en.5: Evaluation and publication of effectiveness in responding to PH Events at PoE

capacities.target_description_fr: Les États parties devraient désigner et maintenir les capacités de base dans les aéroports et ports internationaux (et lorsque cela est justifié pour des raisons de santé publique, un État partie peut désigner des postes frontières) qui mettent en œuvre des mesures de santé publique spécifiques pour gérer divers risques pour la santé publique.
capacities.target_description_en: States Parties should designate and maintain the core capacities at the international airports and ports (and where justified for public health reasons, a State Party may designate ground crossings) which implement specific public health measures required to manage a variety of public health risks.
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Détection opportune et intervention efficace de tous les risques potentiels qui se produisent aux Points d'Entrée.
capacities.desired_impact_en: Timely detection and effective response of any potential hazards that occur at PoE.

capacities.name: Chemical Events
capacities.target_description: States Parties should have surveillance and response capacity for chemical risk or events. This requires effective communication and collaboration among the sectors responsible for chemical safety, industries, transportation and safe disposal.
capacities.desired_impact: Timely detection and effective response of potential chemical risks and/or events in collaboration with other sectors responsible for chemical safety, industries, transportation and safe disposal.
capacities.notes:
Indicators refer to detection and responding to the chemical events and enabling environment for management of chemical events in place with appropriate legislation, laws, or policy and with involvement of multi-sectors.
Detection capacity also includes not only surveillance but also the laboratory capacity required for the verification of any events.

indicators.name: Mechanisms are established and functioning for detecting and responding to chemical events or emergencies

score_descriptions.1: No mechanism in place
score_descriptions.2: Guidelines or manuals on the surveillance, assessment and management of chemical events, intoxication and poisoning are available
score_descriptions.3: Surveillance is in place for chemical events, intoxication, and poisonings with laboratory capacity or access to laboratory capacity to confirm priority chemical events
score_descriptions.4: Timely and systematic information exchange between appropriate chemical units, surveillance units and other relevant sectors about urgent chemical events and potential chemical risks and their response
score_descriptions.5: Adequately resourced poison centre(s) are in place

line_items.name: Portable air quality sensors
line_items.description: Four portable air quality sensors for each intermediate area to perform airborne chemical event surveillance
line_items.references: Assumes a minimum of 4 air quality sensors per intermediate area are needed to detect airborne chemical events

line_items.references_en: Assumes a minimum of 4 air quality sensors per intermediate area are needed to detect airborne chemical events

line_items.name: Mass spectrometers
line_items.description: One mass spectrometer machine for each intermediate area to identify and characterize chemical samples for chemical event surveillance and assessment
line_items.references: Assumes a minimum of 1 mass spectrometer per intermediate area is needed to support sample analysis, and that the machine will be placed in an existing laboratory facility that has reagents needed to process samples in stock
line_items.description_fr: Un spectromètre de masse pour chaque zone intermédiaire afin d'identifier et caractériser les échantillons chimiques pour la surveillance et l'évaluation des événements chimiques

line_items.function_tag_fr: Opérations / mise en œuvre

line_items.references_en: Assumes a minimum of 1 mass spectrometer per intermediate area is needed to support sample analysis, and that the machine will be placed in an existing laboratory facility that has reagents needed to process samples in stock

indicators.name_fr:
Mécanismes fonctionnels en place pour la détection et la riposte à des événements/urgences
d’origine chimique
indicators.name_en: Mechanisms are established and functioning for detecting and responding to chemical events or emergencies

score_descriptions_fr.1: Aucun mécanisme en place
score_descriptions_fr.2: Des lignes directrices ou des manuels sur la surveillance, l'évaluation et la gestion des événements chimiques, l'intoxication et l'empoisonnement sont disponibles
score_descriptions_fr.3: La surveillance est en place pour les événements chimiques, l'intoxication et les empoisonnements avec la capacité de laboratoire ou l'accès à la capacité de laboratoire pour confirmer les événements chimiques prioritaires
score_descriptions_fr.4: Échange d'informations opportun et systématique entre les unités chimiques appropriées, les unités de surveillance et d'autres secteurs concernés concernant les événements chimiques urgents et les risques chimiques potentiels et leur intervention
score_descriptions_fr.5: Des centres antipoison dotés de ressources suffisantes sont en place

score_descriptions_en.1: No mechanism in place
score_descriptions_en.2: Guidelines or manuals on the surveillance, assessment and management of chemical events, intoxication and poisoning are available
score_descriptions_en.3: Surveillance is in place for chemical events, intoxication, and poisonings with laboratory capacity or access to laboratory capacity to confirm priority chemical events
score_descriptions_en.4: Timely and systematic information exchange between appropriate chemical units, surveillance units and other relevant sectors about urgent chemical events and potential chemical risks and their response
score_descriptions_en.5: Adequately resourced poison centre(s) are in place

indicators.name: Enabling environment is in place for management of chemical event

score_descriptions.1: National policies or plans or legislation for chemical event surveillance alert and response do not exist
score_descriptions.2: National policies or plans or legislation for chemical event surveillance alert and response exist
score_descriptions.3: An emergency response plan that defines the roles and responsibilities of relevant agencies in place including inventory of major hazard sites and facilities
score_descriptions.4: Functional mechanisms for multisectoral collaborations for chemical events are in place including involvement in international chemical/toxicological networks. E.g. INTOX?
score_descriptions.5: A chemical event response plan has been tested through occurrence of real event or through simulation exercise and is updated as needed

indicators.name_fr: Un environnement favorable est en place pour la gestion des événements chimiques
indicators.name_en: Enabling environment is in place for management of chemical event

score_descriptions_fr.1: Les politiques ou plans nationaux ou la législation pour l'alerte et l'intervention à la surveillance des événements chimiques n'existent pas
score_descriptions_fr.2: Il existe des politiques ou des plans nationaux ou une législation pour l'alerte et la réponse à la surveillance des événements chimiques
score_descriptions_fr.3: Un plan d'intervention d'urgence qui définit les rôles et les responsabilités des organismes pertinents sont en place, y compris l'inventaire des sites et installations à risque majeur
score_descriptions_fr.4: Des mécanismes fonctionnels pour des collaborations multisectorielles pour des événements chimiques sont en place, y compris la participation à des réseaux chimiques / toxicologiques internationaux. Par ex. INTOX?
score_descriptions_fr.5: Un plan d'intervention en cas d'événement chimique a été testé à la suite d'un événement réel ou d'un exercice de simulation et mis à jour au besoin

score_descriptions_en.1: National policies or plans or legislation for chemical event surveillance alert and response do not exist
score_descriptions_en.2: National policies or plans or legislation for chemical event surveillance alert and response exist
score_descriptions_en.3: An emergency response plan that defines the roles and responsibilities of relevant agencies in place including inventory of major hazard sites and facilities
score_descriptions_en.4: Functional mechanisms for multisectoral collaborations for chemical events are in place including involvement in international chemical/toxicological networks. E.g. INTOX?
score_descriptions_en.5: A chemical event response plan has been tested through occurrence of real event or through simulation exercise and is updated as needed

capacities.target_description_fr: Les États parties devraient avoir une capacité de surveillance et d'intervention en cas de risque ou d'événement chimique. Cela nécessite une communication et une collaboration efficaces entre les secteurs responsables de la sécurité chimique, des industries, du transport et de l'élimination sûre des déchets ou composants.
capacities.target_description_en: States Parties should have surveillance and response capacity for chemical risk or events. This requires effective communication and collaboration among the sectors responsible for chemical safety, industries, transportation and safe disposal.
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Détection rapide et intervention efficace des risques et / ou événements chimiques potentiels en collaboration avec d'autres secteurs responsables de la sécurité chimique, des industries, du transport et de l'élimination sûre des déchets ou composants.
capacities.desired_impact_en: Timely detection and effective response of potential chemical risks and/or events in collaboration with other sectors responsible for chemical safety, industries, transportation and safe disposal.
capacities.notes_fr:
Les indicateurs se réfèrent à la détection et à l'intervention aux événements chimiques et à l'environnement propice à la gestion des événements chimiques en place avec la législation, les lois ou les règlements appropriés et avec une participation multisectorielle.
La capacité de détection comprend non seulement la surveillance mais également les capacités de laboratoire requises pour la vérification de tout événement.
capacities.notes_en:
Indicators refer to detection and responding to the chemical events and enabling environment for management of chemical events in place with appropriate legislation, laws, or policy and with involvement of multi-sectors.
Detection capacity also includes not only surveillance but also the laboratory capacity required for the verification of any events.

capacities.name: Radiation Emergencies
capacities.target_description: States Parties should have surveillance and response capacity for radio-nuclear hazards/events/emergencies. This requires effective communication and collaboration among the sectors responsible for radio-nuclear management.
capacities.desired_impact: Timely detection and effective response of potential radio-nuclear hazards/events/emergencies in collaboration with other sectors responsible for radio- nuclear management.
capacities.notes:
Indicators refer to detection and responding to the radiation emergencies and enabling environment for management of radiation events in place with appropriate legislation, laws, or policy and with involvement of multi-sectors.
Detection capacity also includes not only surveillance but also the laboratory capacity required for the verification of any events with collaboration with laboratory network outside and inside the country.

indicators.name: Mechanisms are established and functioning for detecting and responding to radiological and nuclear emergencies

score_descriptions.1: No coordination and communication mechanism between national authorities responsible for radiological and nuclear events with ministry of health and/or IHR NFP
score_descriptions.2: National authorities responsible for radiological and nuclear events have a designated focal point for coordination and communication with the ministry of health and/or IHR NFP
score_descriptions.3: A radiation emergency response plan exists (could be part of national emergency response plan) and national policies, strategies or plans for national and international transport of radioactive material, samples and waste management including those from hospitals and medical services are established
score_descriptions.4: Functional coordination and communication mechanism between relevant national competent authorities responsible for nuclear regulatory control/ safety, and relevant sectors.
score_descriptions.5: Radiation emergency response drills carried out regularly, including the requesting of international assistance (as needed) and international notification

indicators.name_fr:
Mécanismes fonctionnels en place pour la détection et la riposte aux situations
d’urgence radiologique et nucléaire.
indicators.name_en: Mechanisms are established and functioning for detecting and responding to radiological and nuclear emergencies

score_descriptions_fr.1: Pas de mécanisme de coordination et de communication entre les autorités nationales responsables des événements radiologiques et nucléaires avec le ministère de la santé et / ou le PFN du RSI
score_descriptions_fr.2: Les autorités nationales responsables des événements radiologiques et nucléaires ont un point focal désigné pour la coordination et la communication avec le ministère de la santé et / ou le point focal national RSI
score_descriptions_fr.3: Un plan d'intervention d'urgence radiologique existe (pourrait faire partie du plan national d'intervention d'urgence) et des politiques, stratégies ou plans nationaux de transport national et international de matières radioactives, d'échantillons et de gestion des déchets y compris ceux des hôpitaux et des services médicaux sont établis
score_descriptions_fr.4: Mécanisme de coordination et de communication fonctionnelles entre les autorités nationales compétentes responsables du contrôle / de la sûreté de la réglementation nucléaire et les secteurs concernés.
score_descriptions_fr.5: Exercices d'intervention d'urgence en cas d'irradiation effectués régulièrement, y compris la demande d'aide internationale (au besoin) et la notification internationale

score_descriptions_en.1: No coordination and communication mechanism between national authorities responsible for radiological and nuclear events with ministry of health and/or IHR NFP
score_descriptions_en.2: National authorities responsible for radiological and nuclear events have a designated focal point for coordination and communication with the ministry of health and/or IHR NFP
score_descriptions_en.3: A radiation emergency response plan exists (could be part of national emergency response plan) and national policies, strategies or plans for national and international transport of radioactive material, samples and waste management including those from hospitals and medical services are established
score_descriptions_en.4: Functional coordination and communication mechanism between relevant national competent authorities responsible for nuclear regulatory control/ safety, and relevant sectors.
score_descriptions_en.5: Radiation emergency response drills carried out regularly, including the requesting of international assistance (as needed) and international notification

score_descriptions.2: National authorities responsible for radiological and nuclear events have a designated focal point for coordination and communication with the ministry of health and/or IHR NFP
score_descriptions.3: A radiation emergency response plan exists (could be part of national emergency response plan) and national policies, strategies or plans for national and international transport of radioactive material, samples and waste management including those from hospitals and medical services are established
score_descriptions.4: Functional coordination and communication mechanism between relevant national competent authorities responsible for nuclear regulatory control/ safety, and relevant sectors.
score_descriptions.5: Radiation emergency response drills carried out regularly, including the requesting of international assistance (as needed) and international notification

capacities.target_description_fr: Les États parties devraient avoir une capacité de surveillance et d'intervention en cas de risques / événements / urgences radio-nucléaires. Cela nécessite une communication et une collaboration efficaces entre les secteurs responsables de la gestion nucléaire.
capacities.target_description_en: States Parties should have surveillance and response capacity for radio-nuclear hazards/events/emergencies. This requires effective communication and collaboration among the sectors responsible for radio-nuclear management.
capacities.desired_impact_fr: Détection rapide et intervention efficace des dangers / événements / urgences radio-nucléaires potentiels en collaboration avec d'autres secteurs responsables de la gestion radio-nucléaire.
capacities.desired_impact_en: Timely detection and effective response of potential radio-nuclear hazards/events/emergencies in collaboration with other sectors responsible for radio- nuclear management.
capacities.notes_fr: Les indicateurs se réfèrent à la détection et à l'intervention aux urgences radiologiques et à l'environnement propice à la gestion des événements radiologiques en place avec la législation, les lois ou les règlements appropriés et avec une participation multisectorielle.La capacité de détection comprend non seulement la surveillance mais également les capacités de laboratoire requises pour la vérification de tout événement en collaboration avec le réseau de laboratoires à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur du pays.
capacities.notes_en:
Indicators refer to detection and responding to the radiation emergencies and enabling environment for management of radiation events in place with appropriate legislation, laws, or policy and with involvement of multi-sectors.
Detection capacity also includes not only surveillance but also the laboratory capacity required for the verification of any events with collaboration with laboratory network outside and inside the country.
